verbose_text: The ribosomal inhibitor cycloheximide (CHX), a compound that potently activates SIMH by promoting mitochondrial fusion, increases the population of MEF mtGFP cells containing elongated mitochondria to the same extent observed in Tg treated cells (XREF_FIG and XREF_SUPPLEMENTARY).
evidence: cycloheximide (CHX), a compound that potently activates SIMH by promoting mitochondrial fusion              , increases the population of MEF
